Bang for the buck
What to do for fun

Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Denton is a quiet college town, and I've never felt anything less than safe whilst walking long distances to enjoy its thriving night-life.
UNT has a healthy Greek life, with a full fraternity row and sorority row, the members of which can often be seen on campus tabling for new recruits and raising funds.

The Denton chapter of the International Socialist Organization (ISO), the Feminist Majority Leadership Alliance (FMLA), the Gay and Lesbian Alliance of Denton (GLAD), Young Americans for Liberty (YAL), as well as many other organizations, provide a variety of opportunities for many different kinds of students to feel included and get involved.

Those students who appreciate a population of diverse political views, nationalities, races, religions, sexual orientations, as well as those students who appreciate a strong art community would do well at UNT.

The annual UNT production of the Vagina Monologues and the associated V-Day fundraising effort for local and international women's organizations is particularly popular, well renowned, and effective at raising money and awareness.

UNT has a large working-class student population and for good reason. It actually faces a budget deficit because the quality of services offered is so high compared to the relatively low prices of housing and tuition.

UNT puts on a number of excellent musical performances, features many special guest lecturers, produces some notable plays, and screens several fine films a year, and many residential events (pajama parties, a haunted house in October) provide an array of fun times. It also has a brand new football stadium which is very admirable.
UNT is generous enough to provide five cafeterias, one of which is 100% vegan, one of which specializes in fried comfort foods, and others which, together, represent almost every palate.

There is a great deal of diversity amongst the dorms in terms of style and level of involvement. There's something for those who are quietly studious, those who are full of school spirit, those who love social interaction, and more.

The difficulty curve is great for the average student. I have found that hard work earns an A, and that only a complete lack of effort or really unfortunate circumstances could earn a failing grade. The average student putting in average effort would probably earn a B.
If prospective students were to take a tour of our quaint campus, they would get a good idea of what UNT has to offer for their unique interests and talents. That's all that it takes!

UNT makes the college experience very easy. The teaching staff, in general, is very accommodating of diverse needs and talents, and the other services (dining, housing, transportation, and extracurricular events like plays and musical performances) are all affordable and accessible. It all comes at a relatively low price, as well.

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here The location of this campus, Denton, can be extremely dull at times, but the overall atmosphere of the school is gorgeous. On top of that, there is such a variety of students, you will never have trouble looking for the right crowd to fit in with. Am learning a lot Overall, the University of North Texas is a very accredited institution. However, every now and then you will find a blow off class or professor that might be alot easier/harder than others at the same level.
